## ABOUT US
Boyer Fire Protection has been built on a foundation of integrity, quality, and client satisfaction. We take pride in being a first-generation, family-owned fire sprinkler contractor serving Illinois, Missouri, and Wisconsin. See how our commitment to these core values drives everything we do, from designing and installing systems to building lasting relationships with our clients and partners.
[Learn More](https://boyerfire.com/<https:/boyerfire.com/about-us/>)
![](https://boyerfire.com/)
## Contracting Services
We deliver fire protection contracting services across Missouri, Illinois, and Madison, Wisconsin. From preconstruction to design-build to fire sprinkler installation, retrofits, and special hazard systems, our team is equipped to handle projects of all sizes. 
[Learn More](https://boyerfire.com/<https:/boyerfire.com/contracting-services/>)
## SAFETY
Safety is our top priority. We adhere to a ‘Plan, Protect, Execute’ strategy to ensure the well-being of our team and clients. This approach involves meticulous planning, implementing protective measures, and executing projects with a steadfast commitment to safety. By promoting a culture of accountability and continuous improvement, we strive to maintain the highest safety standards across all operations.
[Learn More](https://boyerfire.com/<https:/boyerfire.com/safety/>)
![](https://boyerfire.com/)
## Inspection & testing
We offer comprehensive fire protection inspections and testing services across Missouri, Illinois, and Madison, Wisconsin. Our licensed sprinkler fitters ensure that fire suppression systems, backflow devices, fire extinguishers, emergency lights, fire pumps, and hydrants comply with NFPA 25 standards and local regulations.
[Learn More](https://boyerfire.com/<https:/boyerfire.com/inspections/>)
## We’ve got you covered
A fire sprinkler contractor serving homes and businesses within Illinois, Missouri, and Wisconsin.
## We’ve got you covered
A fire sprinkler contractor serving homes and businesses within Illinois, Missouri, and Wisconsin.
## West Overland Fire Marshal
![](https://boyerfire.com/)
Thank you and your people for the hard work you do to keep our businesses safe.
## The Joseph Center
![](https://boyerfire.com/)
Owen came out for our inspection and our basement was flooded. He was very professional and flexible with our situation. He went over and beyond and pumped out the water to complete the inspection. Thanks again we are greatly appreciative.
## Project Manager
![](https://boyerfire.com/)
Wanted to give a quick shout out for Josh and his team on site. Josh has continued to navigate a really tough Fire Marshal and an even more challenging inspector with the city. He’s managed to work efficiently with all the other trades around him to hit important Owner deadlines. That effort certainly doesn’t go unnoticed. The team appreciates guys like Josh on our jobsites for helping us run things smoothly and has truly become one of our most reliable teammates.
## Brendon
![](https://boyerfire.com/)
One of the best fire protection companies in the area. They are very thorough and do a great job at keeping the fire suppression system in good standing which also keeps the residents safe. Melvin, Owen, Grayson, and Chris are all great people that I have worked with, and they all do a VERY VERY good job at explaining things to you so you understand what they are doing and why. Thank you guys for all you do!
## Elias
![](https://boyerfire.com/)
Kathleen who answers the phone was extremely helpful. This company went above and beyond to help me out. I would recommend them to anyone! Thanks again.
## Petersmith Family Chiropractic
![](https://boyerfire.com/)
I hired Boyer Fire Protection for the buildout of my chiropractic office. They did a great job and I’d highly recommend them if you need them in the future.
## Tim Schurmann
## _Development Manager at Dover Development_
![](https://boyerfire.com/)
We had a great experience with Richard M. Boyer and the team on our Arnold project. Looking forward to discussing new opportunities in Indiana and beyond!
## Tim Hammer
## _City of Brentwood Fire Marshal_
![](https://boyerfire.com/)
Thank you for always doing a great job and being so thorough on your inspections in Brentwood. I really appreciate Boyer helping us make sure everyone in Brentwood is safe and keeping our firefighters safe.
## Fluid Air
![](https://boyerfire.com/)
Your technician was very knowledgeable and friendly during the 5-year inspection. Appreciate all the detail that was explained.
## Integrity Healthcare
![](https://boyerfire.com/)
The technician was extremely professional and nice. Enjoyed working with Chris and the team.
## Tenant in Mendenhall
![](https://boyerfire.com/)
Thoroughly impressed and very appreciative of technicians courtesy, consideration, and professionalism. His standard of service was exceptional and commendable. I let him know on Friday but I wanted to make sure it was noted and recognized within your organization.

# About Us
## SINCE 2006,
Boyer Fire Protection has been built on a foundation of integrity, quality, and client satisfaction. Founded by President Richard Boyer and Vice President Kathleen Balch in Belleville, IL, we take pride in being a first-generation, family-owned fire sprinkler contractor serving Illinois, Missouri, and Wisconsin.
Our mission is not just about fire protection, it’s about providing peace of mind. By combining innovative solutions, unmatched expertise, and a continued commitment to safety and reliability, we strive to exceed expectations on every project, building trust and relationships that last far beyond the job itself.
## WHAT WE DO
We are a full-service fire protection contractor serving the St. Louis, Missouri/Southern Illinois metropolitan area, and now, Madison, Wisconsin. Boyer Fire Protection designs, installs, maintains, and inspects all types of fire protection systems. Since Boyer Fire Protection started in 2006, it has completed a large variety of projects, which include retail, office buildings, healthcare, educational, religious, industrial, governmental, hospitality, residential projects and more.
Our office staff has over 100 years of combined experience in the fire sprinkler industry. Our commitment to service and customer satisfaction is our number one priority. Boyer Fire Protection prides itself on working with customers from the early design stage to offer the best fire protection system for your project and cost-cutting options.
The experience and expertise of our service department will help keep your fire protection system in compliance with current NFPA 25 Testing and Inspection Standards. Boyer Fire Protection maintains your inspection schedule and files all required reports with the local fire departments, water departments and authorities having jurisdiction.
## BFP Essentials
We’re excited to announce that you can now shop official Boyer Fire Protection gear directly from our website! From branded shirts and hats to outerwear and accessories, our store has everything you need to rep the brand.
![](https://boyerfire.com/about-us/)
## Service Area
Boyer Fire Protection is a full-service fire protection contractor serving the St. Louis, Missouri/Southern Illinois metropolitan area, and now, Madison, Wisconsin. We also cover all the other surrounding communities within a 60 mile radius and 140 mile radius in Missouri.
## Our Affiliates

## COMMERCIAL
When it comes to commercial projects, success depends on experienced trade partners who understand timelines, coordination, and code compliance. From high-rises to tenant fit-outs, we deliver reliable, high-quality fire sprinkler systems that meet your schedule and your budget. Known for our professionalism, job site safety, and responsive project teams, Boyer is the subcontractor that commercial builders and GCs trust to get it right the first time.
![](https://boyerfire.com/projects/)
## EDUCATION
In education, safety isn’t optional, it’s essential. Boyer Fire Protection works closely with schools, universities, and contractors to deliver reliable, code-compliant fire sprinkler systems that protect students, staff, and infrastructure. Whether it’s new construction, renovations, or phased campus upgrades, our team understands the importance of tight timelines, active facilities, and minimal disruption. We’re the trusted subcontractor for educational environments where precision and protection matter most.
## HEALTHCARE
In healthcare, there’s no room for error. From hospitals to medical office buildings, Boyer Fire Protection delivers fire sprinkler systems designed for complex, sensitive environments. We understand the critical nature of these facilities, clean rooms, patient safety, infection control, and 24/7 operations, and work with precision to meet the highest standards. Our team is experienced in navigating active facilities, strict code requirements, and AHJ expectations, making us a trusted partner in protecting patients, staff, and critical infrastructure.
![](https://boyerfire.com/projects/)
## INDUSTRIAL & MANUFACTURING
Industrial and manufacturing facilities demand rugged, code-compliant fire protection systems built to handle complex hazards and high-risk environments. Boyer Fire Protection brings deep experience in protecting warehouses, processing plants, and production facilities, designing and installing systems that align with unique operational needs. We understand the urgency of uptime, safety protocols, and coordination with multiple trades, making us a go-to partner for industrial projects that can’t afford compromise.
## RESIDENTIAL
From multifamily complexes to senior living communities, Boyer Fire Protection delivers reliable fire sprinkler systems that safeguard lives and meet strict code requirements. We understand the challenges of residential construction, tight timelines, occupied units, and evolving designs, and work closely with builders and developers to ensure seamless integration and long-term protection. Whether it’s new construction or retrofit, we help create safer living environments families can count on.
![](https://boyerfire.com/projects/)
## WAREHOUSE & STORAGE
Warehouses and storage facilities require tailored fire protection systems that account for high-piled storage, racking layouts, and specialized commodities. At Boyer Fire Protection, we design and install systems that not only meet NFPA standards but also align with your insurance and operational requirements. With a focus on precision, code compliance, and efficient installation, we help protect valuable inventory and keep your operations moving safely.
## Our Affiliates

pages.title: Careers - Boyer Fire Protection
headings: Design and draft Fire Protection Systems in accordance with all applicable building codes and NFPA standards within the scope of the contract, while conforming piping arrangements to meet standard product or material usage as well as the most efficient installation, fabrication, and stock listing techniques.
Coordinate with clients, internal teams, and vendors on project details, schedules, and changes.
Participate in turnover meetings and assist with customer follow-ups post-award.
Support project management and field teams with technical input and scope revisions.
Assist with estimating, feasibility reviews, and technical interpretations as needed.
Prepare all project documentation, including Valve Charts and Record Drawings.
Communicate via appropriate electronic correspondence and maintain regular check-ins with sales and design leadership.
Source competitive vendor quotes and subcontractor pricing to support bids.
Contribute to bid strategy, preliminary design, and full cost estimates.
Review and finalize estimates with sales staff and prepare customer quotations.
Follow up on bids and actively manage awarded projects from design through completion.
Minimum Associate Degree in Construction, Structure, Mechanical, Architectural, or Fire Protection

ior Designer will also be involved in mentoring Design Technicians and Design Technician Trainees.

# Careers
### join our team
## OPEN POSITIONS
### Connect with us
##### Senior Fire Sprinkler Designer / Project Manager
**Location:** St. Louis, MO, Southern, IL, & Madison, WI
**Position Type:** Full Time
##### Overview
Responsible for creating complete Design Documents of Fire Sprinkler Systems (including submittal and installation drawings, hydraulic calculations, seismic calculations, fabrication stock lists of materials, and closeout valve charts with record drawings) utilizing the appropriate software. The documents are created to seek approval of the authorities having jurisdiction and prefabricate the piping systems.
A Senior Designer is responsible for coordination of all design layouts and communicating with all internal and external project team members. They will assist the sales staff in providing and completing estimates and proposals for certain pre-determined projects and will design and project manage those projects if acquired. A Senior Designer will also be involved in mentoring Design Technicians and Design Technician Trainees.
**Key Responsibilities:**
  * Design and draft Fire Protection Systems in accordance with all applicable building codes and NFPA standards within the scope of the contract, while conforming piping arrangements to meet standard product or material usage as well as the most efficient installation, fabrication, and stock listing techniques.
  * Prepare hydraulic and seismic calculations as required.
  * Coordinate with clients, internal teams, and vendors on project details, schedules, and changes.
  * Obtain required design approvals and maintain organized project records.
  * Generate accurate stocklists for material and fabrication quotes.
  * Participate in turnover meetings and assist with customer follow-ups post-award.
  * Support project management and field teams with technical input and scope revisions.
  * Assist with estimating, feasibility reviews, and technical interpretations as needed.
  * Prepare all project documentation, including Valve Charts and Record Drawings.
  * Communicate via appropriate electronic correspondence and maintain regular check-ins with sales and design leadership.
  * Source competitive vendor quotes and subcontractor pricing to support bids.
  * Contribute to bid strategy, preliminary design, and full cost estimates.
  * Review and finalize estimates with sales staff and prepare customer quotations.
  * Follow up on bids and actively manage awarded projects from design through completion.
  * Perform other duties as assigned.


**Qualifications:**
  * Minimum Associate Degree in Construction, Structure, Mechanical, Architectural, or Fire Protection
  * Minimum of 8 years’ experience with Fire Sprinkler Design
  * Proficient with AutoCAD / HydaCAD, AutoSPRINK, or Revit / HydraCAD drawing softwares
  * Has designed many different project types (ESFR, Residential with CPVC, Fire Pumps, Standpipes, Retrofit, Attics, Pre-action)
  * Able to design any project with no supervision and minimal reviews
  * NICET III or IV Certification and BIM Experience preferred
  * Strong problem-solving, organizational, and communication skills
  * High level of self-discipline, motivation, and teamwork
  * Commitment to ethics, integrity, and safety


[Apply Now](https://boyerfire.com/careers/<https:/boyerfire.com/careers/#apply-now>)
##### Fire Sprinkler Design Layout Technician Trainee
****Location:**** St. Louis, MO, Southern, IL & Madison, WI
**Position Type:** Full Time
##### Overview
Design Technician Trainee reports directly to the V.P. of Design / Design Manager and is responsible for learning how to create Design Documents of Fire Sprinkler Systems (including submittal and installation drawings, hydraulic calculations, seismic calculations, and stock list of materials) utilizing the appropriate software.
**Key Responsibilities**
  * Learn to design and draft Fire Protection Systems in accordance with all applicable building codes and NFPA standards within the scope of the contract, while conforming piping arrangements to meet standard product or material usage as well as the most efficient installation, fabrication, and stock listing techniques.
  * Learn the basics of hydraulic calculations and seismic calculations.
  * Represent Boyer Fire Protection in matters of project coordination, scheduling, change requests, and technical assistance.
  * Help with obtaining necessary approvals and review of project design data.
  * Maintain organized records of active projects in which involved.
  * Prepare smaller stocklists to obtain material and fabrication quotes.
  * Learn how to stocklist larger projects.
  * After a project is awarded, participate in any turnover meetings, share information, and assist with any follow-up with the customer as requested.
  * Learn to assist in managing the projects with Project Managers and Construction Superintendent.
  * Learn to assemble for the Project Manager, material, labor, fabrication, design, and any other costs required in a scope revision (change order).
  * Prepare proper electronic correspondence (coordination, transmittals, confirmation e-mails, etc).
  * Other duties as required.


**Qualifications**
  * Minimum High School Diploma or Associate Degree in Construction, Structure, Mechanical, Architectural, or Fire Protection
  * Ability to physically perform jobsite surveys (involves ladders, heights, construction conditions, etc.)
  * Ability to stay focused while learning a lot of technical information
  * Some experience or knowledge of Construction
  * Strong problem-solving, organizational, and communication skills
  * High level of self-discipline, motivation, and teamwork
  * Commitment to ethics, integrity, and safety

##### Life Safety Sales Representative
****Location:**** St. Louis, MO, Southern, IL & Madison, WI
**Position Type:** Full Time
##### Overview
The Life Safety Sales Representative plays a key role in driving new business by promoting and selling NFPA 25 Inspection, Testing, and Maintenance (ITM) agreements, fire extinguishers, and related services. This position focuses on securing long-term contracts, overseeing project completions, and conducting specialized training for stakeholders.
**Key Responsibilities:**
  * **Sales & Business Development** – Secure 3-5 year NFPA 25 ITM agreements and drive sales of new fire extinguishers and related services.
  * **Client Outreach** – Identify potential customers (building owners, property managers, AHJs) through market research, cold calling, and in-person visits to present proposals and finalize contracts.
  * **Project Closeout & ITM Integration** – Ensure smooth transitions from project completion to ITM agreements, managing barcoding, signage, and compliance documentation.
  * **Customer Relations & Service Agreements** – Address post-installation inquiries, maintain client satisfaction, and follow up on renewals and service agreements.
  * **Training & Education** – Design and deliver at least two annual training sessions for stakeholders, including building owners, property managers, fire departments, and AHJs, on fire protection essentials. Maintain records of training activities.
  * **CRM & Reporting** – Keep detailed client interactions and service agreements updated in the company’s CRM system.


**Qualifications:**
  * Bachelor’s degree in Business, Sales, or related field.
  * 3-5 years of experience in fire protection or related industry.
  * Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Apple products, and CRM software.
  * Strong customer service, interpersonal, and communication skills.
  * Highly organized and detail-oriented, able to manage multiple projects.
  * Ability to work effectively in an office and team environment.
  * Willingness to travel as needed.

##### Life Safety Sales & Fire Extinguisher Technician
****Location:**** Madison, WI
**Position Type:** Full Time
##### Overview
This hybrid role combines business development with hands-on field service expertise, with a focus on selling and securing new customer agreements while also performing inspection, testing, and maintenance of fire extinguishers.
In this position, you’ll build strong client relationships, deliver exceptional customer service, and play a vital role in protecting lives and property through comprehensive fire safety solutions. If you’re passionate about safety, skilled in technical service, and enjoy engaging with customers, we invite you to grow your career with us.
**Key Responsibilities:**
**Sales & Business Development**
  * Promote and secure fire sprinkler inspection agreements.
  * Sell new fire extinguishers and related inspection/testing services.
  * Identify and pursue opportunities through market research, cold calling, and in-person visits.
  * Build strong relationships with building owners, property managers, and AHJs.
  * Maintain detailed records and follow-up using CRM tools.


**Field Inspections & Service**
  * Inspect, test, and maintain fire extinguishers per NFPA 10 and company standards.
  * Plan efficient service routes and manage your own schedule for customer appointments.
  * Generate invoices, process payments, and maintain inspection records.
  * Communicate clearly with clients during site visits and offer recommendations.


**Client Support & Training**
  * Ensure smooth transitions from project closeouts to service agreements.
  * Maintain documentation for barcoding, signage, and compliance.
  * Address customer questions, post-service concerns, and contract renewals.


**Qualifications:**
  * High school diploma required, bachelor’s degree in business or related field preferred.
  * 3–5 years of experience in fire protection sales or field service preferred.
  * Strong understanding of NFPA 10 and NFPA 25 preferred.
  * Excellent communication, time management, and customer service skills.
  * Proficiency with Microsoft Office, Apple products, and CRM software.
  * Comfortable using mobile devices for scheduling and service documentation.
  * Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation.
  * Willingness to travel as needed.


**Compensation & Benefits:**
  * Base hourly wage + commission structure for services completed and new service contracts secured.
  * Opportunity for additional earnings based on performance.
  * Company training and support provided.

##### Sales / Project Manager
****Location:**** St. Louis, MO, Southern, IL & Madison, WI
**Position Type:** Full Time
##### Overview
The Project Manager oversees fire sprinkler projects from design to installation, ensuring constructability, schedule adherence, and field operations coordination. This role requires experience in commercial construction, preferably in the fire sprinkler trade, and involves troubleshooting field issues, managing contracts, and supporting installation teams.
**Key Responsibilities:**
  * **Project Oversight & Coordination** – Review contracts, specifications, and safety requirements, ensuring alignment with project goals.
  * **Technical Expertise** – Interpret and review commercial construction drawings, shop drawings, and material stocklists for accuracy and constructability.
  * **Field Operations & Troubleshooting** – Resolve conflicts among MEP trades, provide on-site engineering support, and attend job site coordination meetings.
  * **Project Administration** – Lead contract administration, scheduling, change orders, material procurement, and quantity tracking.
  * **Performance Monitoring** – Track weekly field productivity, job costs, and method analysis to optimize efficiency and safety.
  * **Mentorship & Training** – Guide less experienced employees in reading construction plans, understanding general construction methods, and project management responsibilities.
  * **Travel Requirement** – Travel to construction job sites and office locations as needed (25%-50%), working in varying climates and environments.


**Qualifications:**
  * Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Fire Protection, Construction Management, or related field (Associate’s degree considered).
  * 4+ years fire sprinkler design experience plus 4+ years in commercial construction; or 5+ years in a related trade construction role.
  * Proficiency in MS Excel, Word, and general computer applications.
  * Strong problem-solving, organizational, and communication skills.
  * High level of self-discipline, motivation, and teamwork.
  * Commitment to ethics, integrity, and safety.
  * Ability to work independently while meeting deadlines and project objectives.

##### 669 Sprinkler Fitter Foreman 
**Location:** Southern IL & Madison, WI
**Position Type:** Full Time
##### Overview
The Sprinkler Fitter Foreman reports to the Superintendent or Branch Manager and is responsible for leading a team of Sprinkler Fitters and Apprentices in the installation, repair, and maintenance of fire sprinkler systems. This role requires strong leadership, technical expertise, and the ability to ensure job site safety, efficiency, and compliance with all applicable codes and standards.
**Key Responsibilities:**
  * **Team Leadership & Supervision** – Lead and supervise Sprinkler Fitters and Apprentices, providing training, mentorship, and on-site support.
  * **Installation & Maintenance** – Oversee the installation, repair, and maintenance of fire sprinkler systems, underground fire mains, and fixed extinguishing systems.
  * **Project Coordination** – Plan, schedule, and coordinate daily work activities, ensuring compliance with safety and code requirements.
  * **Material & Equipment Management** – Maintain and manage inventory, tools, and equipment, ensuring adequate supplies for project completion.
  * **Job Site Oversight & Safety Compliance** – Maintain clean and organized job sites, enforce safety protocols, and conduct quality control inspections.
  * **Stakeholder Communication** – Serve as the primary point of contact for project managers, contractors, and other trades.
  * **Union & Compliance Management **– Ensure adherence to UA Local 669 collective bargaining agreements and industry standards.
  * **Administrative Responsibilities** – Complete work reports, timekeeping, and coordination with HR for personnel matters.
  * **Travel & Field Supervision** – Travel to various job sites in Illinois, Missouri, or Wisconsin as needed to oversee projects.
  * **Emergency Response & Overtime **– Be available for overtime work and emergency service calls as required.


**Requirements:**
  * 5+ years of experience in fire sprinkler system installation and maintenance.
  * UA Local 669 membership in good standing.
  * Proven leadership skills with experience managing a team.
  * Strong knowledge of fire protection systems, industry codes, and safety regulations.
  * Effective communication, organization, and time-management skills.
  * Valid state driver’s license and willingness to travel as needed.
  * Ability to pass a drug screen.
  * High School Diploma or GED (additional industry certifications preferred).
  * Proficiency in industry-specific tools and equipment.
  * Mechanical aptitude and problem-solving skills.


**Physical Requirements:**
  * Ability to walk, stand for long periods, climb ladders, and operate equipment.
  * Must be able to lift and carry tools and materials up to 75 lbs.
  * Frequent use of manlifts and forklifts in job site environments.
  * Requires strong decision-making and problem-solving abilities in high-pressure situations.

In this position, you’ll build strong client relationships, deliver exceptional customer service, and play a vital role in protecting lives and property through comprehensive fire safety solutions. If you’re passionate about safety, skilled in technical service, and enjoy engaging with customers, we invite you to grow your career with us.
  * Identify and pursue opportunities through market research, cold calling, and in-person visits.
  * Build strong relationships with building owners, property managers, and AHJs.


  * Inspect, test, and maintain fire extinguishers per NFPA 10 and company standards.
  * Plan efficient service routes and manage your own schedule for customer appointments.
  * Communicate clearly with clients during site visits and offer recommendations.



  * High school diploma required, bachelor’s degree in business or related field preferred.
  * 3–5 years of experience in fire protection sales or field service preferred.


  * Base hourly wage + commission structure for services completed and new service contracts secured.


The Project Manager oversees fire sprinkler projects from design to installation, ensuring constructability, schedule adherence, and field operations coordination. This role requires experience in commercial construction, preferably in the fire sprinkler trade, and involves troubleshooting field issues, managing contracts, and supporting installation teams.
  * – Review contracts, specifications, and safety requirements, ensuring alignment with project goals.
  * – Interpret and review commercial construction drawings, shop drawings, and material stocklists for accuracy and constructability.
  * – Resolve conflicts among MEP trades, provide on-site engineering support, and attend job site coordination meetings.
  * – Lead contract administration, scheduling, change orders, material procurement, and quantity tracking.
  * – Track weekly field productivity, job costs, and method analysis to optimize efficiency and safety.
  * – Guide less experienced employees in reading construction plans, understanding general construction methods, and project management responsibilities.
  * – Travel to construction job sites and office locations as needed (25%-50%), working in varying climates and environments.


  * Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Fire Protection, Construction Management, or related field (Associate’s degree considered).
  * 4+ years fire sprinkler design experience plus 4+ years in commercial construction; or 5+ years in a related trade construction role.
  * Ability to work independently while meeting deadlines and project objectives.


The Sprinkler Fitter Foreman reports to the Superintendent or Branch Manager and is responsible for leading a team of Sprinkler Fitters and Apprentices in the installation, repair, and maintenance of fire sprinkler systems. This role requires strong leadership, technical expertise, and the ability to ensure job site safety, efficiency, and compliance with all applicable codes and standards.
  * – Lead and supervise Sprinkler Fitters and Apprentices, providing training, mentorship, and on-site support.
  * – Oversee the installation, repair, and maintenance of fire sprinkler systems, underground fire mains, and fixed extinguishing systems.
  * – Plan, schedule, and coordinate daily work activities, ensuring compliance with safety and code requirements.
  * – Maintain and manage inventory, tools, and equipment, ensuring adequate supplies for project completion.
  * – Maintain clean and organized job sites, enforce safety protocols, and conduct quality control inspections.
  * – Serve as the primary point of contact for project managers, contractors, and other trades.
  * – Ensure adherence to UA Local 669 collective bargaining agreements and industry standards.
  * – Complete work reports, timekeeping, and coordination with HR for personnel matters.
  * – Travel to various job sites in Illinois, Missouri, or Wisconsin as needed to oversee projects.
  * – Be available for overtime work and emergency service calls as required.


  * 5+ years of experience in fire sprinkler system installation and maintenance.
  * Strong knowledge of fire protection systems, industry codes, and safety regulations.
  * Valid state driver’s license and willingness to travel as needed.


  * Ability to walk, stand for long periods, climb ladders, and operate equipment.
  * Must be able to lift and carry tools and materials up to 75 lbs.
  * Frequent use of manlifts and forklifts in job site environments.

Careers

OPEN POSITIONS

Connect with us

Senior Fire Sprinkler Designer / Project Manager

Location: St. Louis, MO, Southern, IL, & Madison, WI

Position Type: Full Time

Overview

Responsible for creating complete Design Documents of Fire Sprinkler Systems (including submittal and installation drawings, hydraulic calculations, seismic calculations, fabrication stock lists of materials, and closeout valve charts with record drawings) utilizing the appropriate software. The documents are created to seek approval of the authorities having jurisdiction and prefabricate the piping systems.

A Senior Designer is responsible for coordination of all design layouts and communicating with all internal and external project team members. They will assist the sales staff in providing and completing estimates and proposals for certain pre-determined projects and will design and project manage those projects if acquired. A Senior Designer will also be involved in mentoring Design Technicians and Design Technician Trainees.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and draft Fire Protection Systems in accordance with all applicable building codes and NFPA standards within the scope of the contract, while conforming piping arrangements to meet standard product or material usage as well as the most efficient installation, fabrication, and stock listing techniques.
  • Prepare hydraulic and seismic calculations as required.
  • Coordinate with clients, internal teams, and vendors on project details, schedules, and changes.
  • Obtain required design approvals and maintain organized project records.
  • Generate accurate stocklists for material and fabrication quotes.
  • Participate in turnover meetings and assist with customer follow-ups post-award.
  • Support project management and field teams with technical input and scope revisions.
  • Assist with estimating, feasibility reviews, and technical interpretations as needed.
  • Prepare all project documentation, including Valve Charts and Record Drawings.
  • Communicate via appropriate electronic correspondence and maintain regular check-ins with sales and design leadership.
  • Source competitive vendor quotes and subcontractor pricing to support bids.
  • Contribute to bid strategy, preliminary design, and full cost estimates.
  • Review and finalize estimates with sales staff and prepare customer quotations.
  • Follow up on bids and actively manage awarded projects from design through completion.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

  • Minimum Associate Degree in Construction, Structure, Mechanical, Architectural, or Fire Protection
  • Minimum of 8 years’ experience with Fire Sprinkler Design
  • Proficient with AutoCAD / HydaCAD, AutoSPRINK, or Revit / HydraCAD drawing softwares
  • Has designed many different project types (ESFR, Residential with CPVC, Fire Pumps, Standpipes, Retrofit, Attics, Pre-action)
  • Able to design any project with no supervision and minimal reviews
  • NICET III or IV Certification and BIM Experience preferred
  • Strong problem-solving, organizational, and communication skills
  • High level of self-discipline, motivation, and teamwork
  • Commitment to ethics, integrity, and safety
Apply Now
Fire Sprinkler Design Layout Technician Trainee

Location: St. Louis, MO, Southern, IL & Madison, WI

Position Type: Full Time

Overview

Design Technician Trainee reports directly to the V.P. of Design / Design Manager and is responsible for learning how to create Design Documents of Fire Sprinkler Systems (including submittal and installation drawings, hydraulic calculations, seismic calculations, and stock list of materials) utilizing the appropriate software.

Key Responsibilities

  • Learn to design and draft Fire Protection Systems in accordance with all applicable building codes and NFPA standards within the scope of the contract, while conforming piping arrangements to meet standard product or material usage as well as the most efficient installation, fabrication, and stock listing techniques.
  • Learn the basics of hydraulic calculations and seismic calculations.
  • Represent Boyer Fire Protection in matters of project coordination, scheduling, change requests, and technical assistance.
  • Help with obtaining necessary approvals and review of project design data.
  • Maintain organized records of active projects in which involved.
  • Prepare smaller stocklists to obtain material and fabrication quotes.
  • Learn how to stocklist larger projects.
  • After a project is awarded, participate in any turnover meetings, share information, and assist with any follow-up with the customer as requested.
  • Learn to assist in managing the projects with Project Managers and Construction Superintendent.
  • Learn to assemble for the Project Manager, material, labor, fabrication, design, and any other costs required in a scope revision (change order).
  • Prepare proper electronic correspondence (coordination, transmittals, confirmation e-mails, etc).
  • Other duties as required.

Qualifications

  • Minimum High School Diploma or Associate Degree in Construction, Structure, Mechanical, Architectural, or Fire Protection
  • Ability to physically perform jobsite surveys (involves ladders, heights, construction conditions, etc.)
  • Ability to stay focused while learning a lot of technical information
  • Some experience or knowledge of Construction
  • Strong problem-solving, organizational, and communication skills
  • High level of self-discipline, motivation, and teamwork
  • Commitment to ethics, integrity, and safety
Apply Now
Life Safety Sales Representative

Location: St. Louis, MO, Southern, IL & Madison, WI

Position Type: Full Time

Overview

The Life Safety Sales Representative plays a key role in driving new business by promoting and selling NFPA 25 Inspection, Testing, and Maintenance (ITM) agreements, fire extinguishers, and related services. This position focuses on securing long-term contracts, overseeing project completions, and conducting specialized training for stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Sales & Business Development – Secure 3-5 year NFPA 25 ITM agreements and drive sales of new fire extinguishers and related services.
  • Client Outreach – Identify potential customers (building owners, property managers, AHJs) through market research, cold calling, and in-person visits to present proposals and finalize contracts.
  • Project Closeout & ITM Integration – Ensure smooth transitions from project completion to ITM agreements, managing barcoding, signage, and compliance documentation.
  • Customer Relations & Service Agreements – Address post-installation inquiries, maintain client satisfaction, and follow up on renewals and service agreements.
  • Training & Education – Design and deliver at least two annual training sessions for stakeholders, including building owners, property managers, fire departments, and AHJs, on fire protection essentials. Maintain records of training activities.
  • CRM & Reporting – Keep detailed client interactions and service agreements updated in the company’s CRM system.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Sales, or related field.
  • 3-5 years of experience in fire protection or related industry.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Apple products, and CRM software.
  • Strong customer service, interpersonal, and communication skills.
  • Highly organized and detail-oriented, able to manage multiple projects.
  • Ability to work effectively in an office and team environment.
  • Willingness to travel as needed.
Apply Now
Inspection Coordinator

Location: St. Louis, MO

Position Type: Full Time

Overview

This role is designed to combine customer communication, scheduling, and data entry/billing, making it a central part of keeping our inspection operation organized, compliant, and running smoothly. We’re seeking someone who enjoys both talking to people and working with systems, someone who’s ready to manage inspection schedules, enter accurate job data, and support our team in the field and the office.

Key Responsibilities

Scheduling & Coordination:

  • Schedule annual and recurring inspections for Field Technicians by communicating with current customers

  • Coordinate monthly inspection routes and dispatch work using our database systems

  • Maintain scheduling spreadsheets and track job progress

  • Serve as main point of contact for our scheduling email and communicate with inspection technicians daily

  • Assist with organizing technician schedules in coordination with inspection volume and customer deadlines

Customer & Team Support

  • Respond to incoming customer requests and outline inspection follow-up needs
  • Manage customer portals and ensure inspection data is up to date
  • Assist with quoting inspections, renewing contracts, and creating price lists
  • Help manage inspection paperwork and ensure proper filing with authorities and clients

Administrative & Billing

  • Set up all inspection jobs in our inspection management software
  • Review and update sites with accurate information during setup / scheduling process
  • Bill all completed inspection jobs and send appropriate paperwork to clients
  • Track renewal schedules and assist in maintaining ongoing customer contracts
  • Serve as a go-to resource for field staff needing software updates or on-the-fly scheduling changes during

Qualifications:

  • Associate’s degree preferred; interest in fire protection or life safety is a plus
  • Minimum of 1 year of relevant work experience preferred
  • Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and comfortable using Apple products
  • Strong organizational skills with a sharp eye for detail
  • Excellent time management and multitasking abilities in a fast-paced environment
  • Able to interact professionally with customers, vendors, and field technicians
  • Customer service experience is a plus
  • Team player who enjoys working in an office-based, collaborative environment
  • Flexible and able to adapt to shifting schedules, priorities, and workflow needs
Apply Now
Designer (Fire Sprinkler Layout Technician)

Location: St. Louis, MO, Southern, IL & Madison, WI

Position Type: Full Time

Overview

Design Technician reports directly to the V.P. of Design / Design Manager and is responsible for creating complete Design Documents of Fire Sprinkler Systems (including submittal and installation drawings, hydraulic calculations, seismic calculations, fabrication stock lists of materials, and closeout valve charts with record drawings) utilizing the appropriate software. The documents are created to seek approval of the authorities having jurisdiction and prefabricate the piping systems. A Design Technician is responsible for coordination of all design layouts and communicating with all external project team members and Boyer Fire Protection project team members

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and draft Fire Protection Systems in accordance with all applicable building codes and NFPA standards within the scope of the contract, while conforming piping arrangements to meet standard product or material usage as well as the most efficient installation, fabrication, and stock listing techniques.
  • Prepare hydraulic calculations and seismic calculations for all required projects
  • Coordinate with clients and internal teams on scheduling, design reviews, changes, and approvals.
  • Conduct job-site surveys and maintain organized project records.
  • Generate accurate stocklists for material and fabrication quotes.
  • Participate in project turnover meetings, customer follow-ups, and site meetings as needed.
  • Support project managers and field supervisors with technical input, scope revisions, and cost breakdowns.
  • Assist with estimating, feasibility reviews, and design interpretations.
  • Prepare electronic correspondence, valve charts, record drawings, and other closeout documentation.
  • Perform additional tasks as directed by the VP of Design or Design Manager.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Minimum Associate Degree in Construction, Structure, Mechanical, Architectural, or Fire Protection
  • Minimum of 3 years’ experience with Fire Sprinkler Design
  • Proficient with AutoCAD / HydaCAD, AutoSPRINK, or Revit / HydraCAD drawing softwares
  • Has designed many different project types (ESFR, Residential with CPVC, Fire Pumps, Standpipes, Retrofit, Attics, Pre-action)
  • Able to design any project with minimal supervision and reviews
  • NICET II Certification and some BIM exposure preferred
  • Strong problem-solving, organizational, and communication skills
  • High level of self-discipline, motivation, and teamwork
  • Commitment to ethics, integrity, and safety
Apply Now
Life Safety Sales & Fire Extinguisher Technician

Location: Madison, WI

Position Type: Full Time

The Project Manager oversees fire sprinkler projects from design to installation, ensuring constructability, schedule adherence, and field operations coordination. 669 Sprinkler Fitter Foreman

The Sprinkler Fitter Foreman reports to the Superintendent or Branch Manager and is responsible for leading a team of Sprinkler Fitters and Apprentices in the installation, repair, and maintenance of fire sprinkler systems. This role requires strong leadership, technical expertise, and the ability to ensure job site safety, efficiency, and compliance with all applicable codes and standards.

# NYC FIRE SPRINKLER INSTALLATIONS, INSPECTIONS, VIOLATIONS & TESTING
Since 1952, our mission at Capitol Fire Sprinkler has been the same: to save lives and protect property from fire. Trust us to install, design, inspect, test, maintain, and repair your fire sprinkler systems. We are proudly licensed in New York City, Long Island, Westchester, and New Jersey. 
[REQUEST A FREE ESTIMATE](https://www.capitolfire.com/</contact-us>)
## NFPA INSPECTIONS, FDNY VIOLATIONS & TESTING
Capitol Fire Sprinkler is a full-service and licensed fire sprinkler company proudly helping thousands of residential, commercial, and industrial buildings in the New York area protect their property and people. Our specialties include the removal of FDNY violations along with NFPA25 inspections. We have a division dedicated to the installation of new sprinkler systems, and a second division to handle all repairs, tests, inspections, and violation removals. We also offer inspections and maintenance for fire extinguishers. Our service area includes: Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens, Bronx, Staten Island, Long Island, Westchester and Northern New Jersey.
[ ![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/668f0e4d83839941245147df/66c7767f6a060fd01ca513d8_violationIcon.webp)Violations Our experienced staff will walk you through your violation and quickly provide solutions to help you correct it. ](https://www.capitolfire.com/<#>)
[ ![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/668f0e4d83839941245147df/66c7767d793cfeb2a4ddd321_ll26Icon.webp)Local Law 26 Capitol Fire Sprinkler can help your building with Local Law 26 compliance. We have experience designing and retroactively installing fire sprinkler systems in a number of office buildings throughout NYC. ](https://www.capitolfire.com/<#>)
[ ![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/668f0e4d83839941245147df/66c7767dbd400016b2f7dbd1_nfpaIcon.webp)NFPA 25 NFPA25 outlines inspection and testing procedures for different fire sprinkler system types. At Capitol Fire, we specialize in helping your building comply with NFPA 25. Request service today to get started. ](https://www.capitolfire.com/<#>)
[ ![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/668f0e4d83839941245147df/66c7767d3a14eeb9959ffe8d_installationIcon.webp)Installations From consultation to designs and engineering to installation, our experienced team can assist you with new installations of all types of systems from start to finish. ](https://www.capitolfire.com/<#>)
[ ![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/668f0e4d83839941245147df/66c7767ff836146342659124_winterizationIcon.webp)Winterization Capitol Fire Sprinkler offer winterization services to ensure that dry pipe sprinkler systems in NYC are not damaged during the coldest months of the year. ](https://www.capitolfire.com/<#>)
[ ![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/668f0e4d83839941245147df/66c7767d3a8d622e0ef218d4_inspectionIcon.webp)Inspections We perform routine inspections to fulfill Fire Department and Insurance Company requirements, and most importantly to ensure your safety. ](https://www.capitolfire.com/<#>)
[ ![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/668f0e4d83839941245147df/66c7767ff44a27015dc67a6d_testingIcon.webp)Testing We can determine the functionality of your sprinkler system by performing required testing. ](https://www.capitolfire.com/<#>)
[ ![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/668f0e4d83839941245147df/66c7767e74b92ebcce7c4775_repairIcon.webp)Repairs Our highly skilled and trained service technicians are dedicated 24/7 to making sure your system is in proper working condition. ](https://www.capitolfire.com/<#>)
[ ![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/668f0e4d83839941245147df/66c7767f25f5425a66ff10fc_extinguisherIcon.webp)Fire Extinguishers Complete examination of your fire extinguisher to make sure it is fully charged and will function properly. ](https://www.capitolfire.com/<#>)

  * **3,000+** CURRENT SERVICE CUSTOMERS

pages.cleaned_html:
CONTACT US
|

NYC FIRE SPRINKLER INSTALLATIONS, INSPECTIONS, VIOLATIONS & TESTING

Since 1952, our mission at Capitol Fire Sprinkler has been the same: to save lives and protect property from fire. Trust us to install, design, inspect, test, maintain, and repair your fire sprinkler systems. We are proudly licensed in New York City, Long Island, Westchester, and New Jersey.

REQUEST A FREE ESTIMATE

NFPA INSPECTIONS, FDNY VIOLATIONS & TESTING

Capitol Fire Sprinkler is a full-service and licensed fire sprinkler company proudly helping thousands of residential, commercial, and industrial buildings in the New York area protect their property and people. Our specialties include the removal of FDNY violations along with NFPA25 inspections. We have a division dedicated to the installation of new sprinkler systems, and a second division to handle all repairs, tests, inspections, and violation removals. We also offer inspections and maintenance for fire extinguishers. Our service area includes: Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens, Bronx, Staten Island, Long Island, Westchester and Northern New Jersey.

Violations

Our experienced staff will walk you through your violation and quickly provide solutions to help you correct it.

Local Law 26

Capitol Fire Sprinkler can help your building with Local Law 26 compliance. We have experience designing and retroactively installing fire sprinkler systems in a number of office buildings throughout NYC.

NFPA 25

NFPA25 outlines inspection and testing procedures for different fire sprinkler system types. At Capitol Fire, we specialize in helping your building comply with NFPA 25. Request service today to get started.

Installations

From consultation to designs and engineering to installation, our experienced team can assist you with new installations of all types of systems from start to finish.

Winterization

Capitol Fire Sprinkler offer winterization services to ensure that dry pipe sprinkler systems in NYC are not damaged during the coldest months of the year.

Inspections

We perform routine inspections to fulfill Fire Department and Insurance Company requirements, and most importantly to ensure your safety.

Testing

We can determine the functionality of your sprinkler system by performing required testing.

Repairs

Our highly skilled and trained service technicians are dedicated 24/7 to making sure your system is in proper working condition.

Fire Extinguishers

Complete examination of your fire extinguisher to make sure it is fully charged and will function properly.

24/7 Emergency Service since 1952

  • 4,000+COMPLETED INSTALLATION JOBS
  • 3,000+CURRENT SERVICE CUSTOMERS
  • 60+YEARS OF BUSINESS
  • 3GENERATIONS

We Are Proudly Associated With

Privacy Policy

Blog
CALL
FOR A FREE ESTIMATE!

# About   
Experts in Fire Safety 
Nova Fire Protection Inc. helps Chicago homeowners and businesses stay safe with professional fire sprinkler system design, installation, repair, inspection, and testing. We also offer emergency service and precision system retrofitting.
[Learn More ](https://novafp.com/<https:/novafp.com/fire-sprinkler-system-repair-chicago/>)
# Residential   
Fire Sprinkler Systems 
Our residential team is skilled at finding the perfect balance between form and function while providing fire protection. You choose the sprinkler style and colors to match your home's aesthetic décor.
[Learn More ](https://novafp.com/<https:/novafp.com/home-fire-sprinklers-schaumburg/>)
# Commercial   
Fire Sprinkler Systems 
Our commercial team provides fire suppression solutions for a wide variety of buildings from small retail shops to sprawling warehouses and towering high rises. They also do data centers!
[Learn More ](https://novafp.com/<https:/novafp.com/commercial-fire-sprinklers-chicago/>)
### Residential
#### Residential
Keep your family and your residential property protected with state-of-the-art fire sprinkler systems specially designed and installed for your residential structure.
[Learn More](https://novafp.com/<https:/novafp.com/home-fire-sprinklers-schaumburg/>)
### Commercial
#### Commercial
Nova Fire Protection has the credentials to handle commercial projects of every size and scope. Expect the best protection and service from our professional team.
[Learn More](https://novafp.com/<https:/novafp.com/commercial-fire-sprinklers-chicago/>)
###  Contact Us for a Free Estimate
[Contact Us](https://novafp.com/<#!>)
## Nova Fire Protection Inc.
### Keeping Chicagoland Safe
Nova Fire Protection Inc. takes pride in keeping Chicago safe from fires. We’re a team of fully licensed fire sprinkler engineers dedicated to serving local homeowners, businesses, and property managers throughout the region. With over 25 years of local experience, our team is ready to handle fire sprinkler projects of every size and scope with quality engineering and signature service.
Our company provides comprehensive design, installation, repair, inspection, and testing for fire sprinkler systems and fire pumps. Due to the urgent nature of our industry, we also offer 24-7 emergency service and system retrofitting to keep your fire sprinklers fully operational. There’s nobody more reliable than Nova Fire Protection!
[ Learn More
* * * ](https://novafp.com/<https:/novafp.com/fire-sprinkler-system-repair-chicago/>)
![](https://novafp.com/site/wp-content/themes/theme-hollow/img/content/c1.jpg)
## Serving Local Clients
Nova Fire Protection Inc. has proudly served homeowners, businesses, and property managers over the last 25 years. Our clients can be found across Schaumburg, Rosemont, Naperville, Arlington Heights, Aurora, Melrose Park, Oak Brook, Chicago, Wheaton, Lombard, Elk Grove, Oak Park, Evanston, Bolingbrook, and many other communities.
[Learn More](https://novafp.com/<https:/novafp.com/?page_id=276>)
#### Get in Touch
## Contact Information
* * *
Ready to install a new fire sprinkler system or schedule service for an existing one? Get in touch with the fire sprinkler experts at Nova Fire Protection today!

Experts in Fire Safety

Nova Fire Protection Inc. helps Chicago homeowners and businesses stay safe with professional fire sprinkler system design, installation, repair, inspection, and testing. We also offer emergency service and precision system retrofitting.

Fire Sprinkler Systems

Our residential team is skilled at finding the perfect balance between form and function while providing fire protection. You choose the sprinkler style and colors to match your home's aesthetic décor.

Fire Sprinkler Systems

Our commercial team provides fire suppression solutions for a wide variety of buildings from small retail shops to sprawling warehouses and towering high rises. They also do data centers!

Residential

Residential

Keep your family and your residential property protected with state-of-the-art fire sprinkler systems specially designed and installed for your residential structure.

Commercial

Commercial

Nova Fire Protection has the credentials to handle commercial projects of every size and scope. Expect the best protection and service from our professional team.

Contact Us

Nova Fire Protection Inc.

Keeping Chicagoland Safe

Nova Fire Protection Inc. takes pride in keeping Chicago safe from fires. We’re a team of fully licensed fire sprinkler engineers dedicated to serving local homeowners, businesses, and property managers throughout the region. With over 25 years of local experience, our team is ready to handle fire sprinkler projects of every size and scope with quality engineering and signature service.

Our company provides comprehensive design, installation, repair, inspection, and testing for fire sprinkler systems and fire pumps. Due to the urgent nature of our industry, we also offer 24-7 emergency service and system retrofitting to keep your fire sprinklers fully operational. There’s nobody more reliable than Nova Fire Protection!

Learn More

Serving Local Clients

Nova Fire Protection Inc. has proudly served homeowners, businesses, and property managers over the last 25 years. Our clients can be found across Schaumburg, Rosemont, Naperville, Arlington Heights, Aurora, Melrose Park, Oak Brook, Chicago, Wheaton, Lombard, Elk Grove, Oak Park, Evanston, Bolingbrook, and many other communities.

# Commercial Fire Sprinkler Systems
## Design, fabrication and installation of fire sprinkler systems
### Serving Local Businesses & Property Managers
Nova Fire Protection provides Chicagoland businesses with a wide range of fire sprinkler system services that afford better protection from fire damage at a highly competitive rate. We also serve general contractors and property developers building new structures by designing and implementing fully code-compliant fire sprinkler systems. Our clients enjoy greater peace of mind knowing they have a fully functional fire sprinkler system that is supported by the best testing, inspection, and repair engineers in the industry.

Veteran Fire & Backflow really knows there stuff. I had a major emergency in the middle of the night and I was able to get ahold of them to come help. They took the time to explain what was wrong with my equipment and the best way to move forward. They are always professional and reliable! They have my business for life!

**Veteran Fire and Backflow**
# Safeguarding _**_lives and properties_**_ is our passion
Providing unparalleled inspections, testing, and maintenance services to fortify  
businesses and individuals with the utmost fire and life safety protection
[Contact Us](https://veteran-fire.com/</get-a-quote/>)
## About Us
Welcome to Veteran Fire & Backflow, where safeguarding lives and properties is our passion. Our journey began from a deep-rooted commitment to mitigating the devastating effects of emergencies like fires. Having spent considerable time in the fire safety industry, I recognized the pivotal role played by reliable safety systems. Witnessing firsthand how well-maintained fire systems could halt disaster’s reach fueled the inspiration behind this endeavor.
Our mission? Providing unparalleled inspections, testing, and maintenance services to fortify businesses and individuals with the utmost fire and life safety protection. It’s more than compliance; it’s about instilling peace of mind. Our vision transcends standard offerings—tailoring services to the distinct needs of each client, ensuring personalized solutions and exceptional care.
At the core of Veteran Fire & Backflow lies a commitment to client satisfaction and fostering enduring relationships. We strive not only to meet expectations but to surpass them, leaving a positive imprint on the lives and communities we serve. Join us in our dedication to surpass boundaries, exceed expectations, and make a lasting, positive impact.
![experience](https://veteran-fire.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/12/experience-100x100.png)
### Commitment to Excellence
Commitment to Excellence We are rooted in the values and discipline instilled through my military service. We are dedicated to getting the job done right.
![achievements](https://veteran-fire.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/12/achievements-100x100.png)
### Extensive Experience
We bring our customers over 20 years of my experience and knowledge in the Fire Safety Industry. Alongside our experience, we hold some of the highest certifications in the trade.
![equality](https://veteran-fire.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/12/equality-100x100.png)
### Strong Work Ethics
Infused with a military work ethic, I bring this commitment to our company. Ensuring customer trust in our relentless dedication to their safety, we prioritize delivering top-quality work.
![integration](https://veteran-fire.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/12/integration-100x100.png)
### Integrity
We’re dedicated to forging lasting partnerships, becoming integral in maintaining our customers’ Fire Safety Equipment. Upholding fairness and honesty in all our endeavors is essential to fostering these enduring relationships.
[Get a Quote](https://veteran-fire.com/</get-a-quote/>)

Your Trusted source of fire equipment, inspection, testing and maintenance.Your Trusted source of fire equipment, inspection, testing and maintenance.Your Trusted source of fire equipment, inspection, testing and maintenance.
Experts in providing fire safety services and code compliance to keep you and your property safe.
[Contact Us](https://regalfireprotection.com/</>)
## About Regal Fire Protection
![](https://img1.wsimg.com/isteam/stock/3371/:/cr=t:12.5%25,l:0%25,w:100%25,h:75%25/rs=w:600,h:300,cg:true)
#### Our Mission
At Regal Fire Protection, our mission is to provide top-quality service to our customers. We strive to ensure that our clients are always safe and secure.
![](https://img1.wsimg.com/isteam/stock/3370/:/cr=t:12.48%25,l:0%25,w:100%25,h:75.03%25/rs=w:600,h:300,cg:true)
#### Our History
Dedicated to excellence, Regal Fire Protections technicians have been providing fire safety systems inspections and testing to customers in the greater Cleveland area for over 15 years. Our team has the expertise to meet all your fire safety needs. 
![](https://img1.wsimg.com/isteam/stock/20046/:/cr=t:12.55%25,l:0%25,w:100%25,h:74.9%25/rs=w:600,h:300,cg:true)
#### Our Products
We offer a wide range of fire protection services and equipment, including testing and maintenance of fire extinguishers, fire alarms, sprinklers and fire suppression systems. Partnering with industry leaders to provide high-quality products that meet industry standards.

Interstate Fire Protection stands as the beacon of trust and efficacy in New England’s fire safety domain. Our establishments in Maine and New Hampshire are the nerve centers from which we extend our expertise, aiding countless enterprises in shielding their prized assets from fire’s wrath. Our success is carved out of deploying robust Fire Protection measures tailored to client requisites, encompassing a spectrum from simplistic pre-engineered systems to advanced multi-hazard clean agent frameworks, each fortress safeguarding millions in assets. Our journey is not merely about averting calamities—it is about forging a safer tomorrow. 
[](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/services/>)
## Customized Solutions
Interstate Fire Protection offers tailored fire suppression systems to meet the unique needs of different industries and applications
[](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/services/>)
## Wide Range of Services
We provide a diverse range of services including installation, maintenance, and various fire suppression systems, catering to both occupied and unoccupied spaces
[](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/services/>)
## Expertise Across Industries
Our expertise spans across multiple industries such as healthcare, industry, data centers, and more, providing specialized solutions for each sector.
[Learn More About Us](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/about> "Learn More About Us")
## Design Services
  * Submittals for permitting
  * Engineering Specifications & Calculations
  * C.A.D. Drawing
  * Cost Engineering


[More about Design Services](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/services/design-services/> "Design Services")
## Installation
  * Engineered Clean Agent Systems
  * High Carbon Dioxide Fire Systems
  * Low Pressure Carbon Dioxide Systems
  * Fire Alarm Systems


[Learn More about Installation](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/services/installation> "Installation")
## Inspection
  * Thorough Inspection
  * Code Compliance
  * Detailed Reporting
  * Maintenance Recommendations


[Learn More about Inspection](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection> "Inspection")
## Maintenance + Repair
  * Regular Maintenance
  * Swift Repairs
  * Quality Assurance
  * System Optimization


[More about Maintenance + Repair](https://www.interstatefire.com/</services/maintenance-repair> "Maintenance + Repair")
## Our Products
[View all products](https://www.interstatefire.com/</interstate-products> "Products")
Interstate Fire Protection offers a wide array of products, each designed to cater to distinct fire safety needs across various industries. Their offerings include Clean Agent Systems, Vehicle Fire Suppression Systems, Kitchen Fire Suppression, Gas Island Fire Suppression, Marine Fire Suppression, Fire Extinguishers, and other products like paint spray booth systems, water mist systems, firefighting foam, first aid kits, fire hoses, emergency lighting, smoke detectors, and high sensitivity detection systems. These products are engineered to provide comprehensive, cost-effective, and practical solutions ensuring the safety and protection of your valuable assets against fire hazards. 
[ ![](https://www.interstatefire.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/IMG_3215-1-scaled.jpeg) ](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/fire-alarms/>)
[Fire Alarm Systems](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/fire-alarms/>)
Interstate Fire Protection provides state-of-the-art fire alarm systems designed for early detection and alert during fire emergencies, ensuring a safe and prompt response.
[More about Fire Alarm Systems](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/fire-alarms/> "Product: Fire Alarm Systems")
[ ![](https://www.interstatefire.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/Water-Mist-Photo-scaled.jpeg) ](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/water-mist-systems/>)
[Water Mist Systems](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/water-mist-systems/>)
Interstate Fire Protection's water mist systems provide efficient fire suppression, utilizing minimal water to rapidly cool and extinguish fires, ensuring asset and environmental safety
[More about Water Mist Systems](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/water-mist-systems/> "Product: Water Mist Systems")
[ ![Fire Extinguishers](https://www.interstatefire.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/621bbb2354c1fe3b350e7c46_fire-extinguishers-min.jpg) ](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/fire-extinguishers/>)
[Fire Extinguishers](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/fire-extinguishers/>)
From fueling depots to vacation homes, with our product lines of clean agent, liquid agent, dry chemical, foam, CO2 and water based hand held and wheeled units from ANSUL, Badger and Pyro-Chem, Interstate Fire has the extinguisher solution to fit your individual need. Please tell your Safety Director that Interstate Fire also offers classroom and hands on extinguisher training.
[More about Fire Extinguishers](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/fire-extinguishers/> "Product: Fire Extinguishers")
[ ![](https://www.interstatefire.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/622900130cc87c8d3745d3f1_IMG_0284-2.jpg) ](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/marine-fire-suppression/>)
[Marine Fire Suppression](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/marine-fire-suppression/>)
Protecting your operations from downtime and your critical assets from fire damage is Interstate Fire’s number one priority. Being factory trained and authorized distributors for ANSUL Fire Protection and Kidde Fire Systems our experts can custom fit a suppression system for your equipment that will minimize installation space and maximize fire protection.
[More about Marine Fire Suppression](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/marine-fire-suppression/> "Product: Marine Fire Suppression")
[ ![Gas Island Fire Suppression](https://www.interstatefire.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/621bbb779bbd8f1085f10fba_gas-island-fire-suppression-min.jpg) ](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/gas-island/>)
[Gas Island](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/gas-island/>)
Protecting your operations from downtime and your critical assets from fire damage is Interstate Fire’s number one priority. Being factory trained and authorized distributors for ANSUL Fire Protection and Kidde Fire Systems our experts can custom fit a suppression system for your equipment that will minimize installation space and maximize fire protection.
[More about Gas Island](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/gas-island/> "Product: Gas Island")
[ ![Kitchen Fire Suppression](https://www.interstatefire.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/6228ccc55b9892f7a0dbca7a_FHDK3083-1.jpeg) ](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/kitchen-fire-suppression/>)
[Kitchen Fire Suppression](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/kitchen-fire-suppression/>)
Interstate Fire Protection offers tailored kitchen fire suppression systems to meet specific needs. They provide standard or hybrid water/wet chemical systems, allowing for easy cleanup post-discharge and minimizing downtime. Particularly, hybrid systems are cost-effective for large kitchens and offer design flexibility, allowing appliance rearrangement without needing system nozzle reinstallation. For non-commercial cooking appliances, the Denlar Fire Suppression Range Hood is offered, ideal for various facilities like Assisted Living Homes, Churches, and Public-School Classrooms, providing an affordable fire protection solution. 
[More about Kitchen Fire Suppression](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/kitchen-fire-suppression/> "Product: Kitchen Fire Suppression")
Real-life results
## We generate results for our customers
“Interstate Fire Protection serviced our Ansul system and fire extinguishers earlier this year. The timely response and service was terrific. Our technicians, Matt and Ben, were professional and the parts required in-stock. As those in the restaurant industry know, it can be tough to maintain quality + production, but Interstate Fire Protection reduced our downtime to service our systems and we were back online quickly.”
Denise H.
“Our smoke detectors all needed to be replaced. Interstate Fire Protection responded quickly with professional service. We were more than pleased with their service.”
Diane Franey
“Very helpful and friendly people. I definitely recommend them for any of your fire extinguishers/suppression needs.”
Joe Smith
Let’s work on your project together
## Got a question?
We would love to help! Feel free to reach out to us at any of our locations listed below. We are here for you Monday to Friday from 8am to 5pm, but do not worry, we have you covered with emergency services available 24/7. Looking forward to assisting you with all your fire protection needs!
[Contact Us](https://www.interstatefire.com/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/services/> "Contact Us")

Protecting your operations from downtime and your critical assets from fire damage is Interstate Fire’s number one priority. Being factory trained and authorized distributors for ANSUL Fire Protection and Kidde Fire Systems our experts can custom fit a suppression system for your equipment that will minimize installation space and maximize fire protection.

More about Gas Island
Kitchen Fire Suppression

Interstate Fire Protection offers tailored kitchen fire suppression systems to meet specific needs. They provide standard or hybrid water/wet chemical systems, allowing for easy cleanup post-discharge and minimizing downtime. Particularly, hybrid systems are cost-effective for large kitchens and offer design flexibility, allowing appliance rearrangement without needing system nozzle reinstallation. For non-commercial cooking appliances, the Denlar Fire Suppression Range Hood is offered, ideal for various facilities like Assisted Living Homes, Churches, and Public-School Classrooms, providing an affordable fire protection solution.

More about Kitchen Fire Suppression

Real-life results

We generate results for our customers

“Interstate Fire Protection serviced our Ansul system and fire extinguishers earlier this year. The timely response and service was terrific. Our technicians, Matt and Ben, were professional and the parts required in-stock. As those in the restaurant industry know, it can be tough to maintain quality + production, but Interstate Fire Protection reduced our downtime to service our systems and we were back online quickly.”

Denise H.

“Our smoke detectors all needed to be replaced. Interstate Fire Protection responded quickly with professional service. We were more than pleased with their service.”

Diane Franey

“Very helpful and friendly people. I definitely recommend them for any of your fire extinguishers/suppression needs.”

Joe Smith

Let’s work on your project together

Got a question?

We would love to help! Feel free to reach out to us at any of our locations listed below. We are here for you Monday to Friday from 8am to 5pm, but do not worry, we have you covered with emergency services available 24/7. Looking forward to assisting you with all your fire protection needs!
