## The Interstate Difference
Interstate Fire Protection stands as the beacon of trust and efficacy in New England’s fire safety domain. Our establishments in Maine and New Hampshire are the nerve centers from which we extend our expertise, aiding countless enterprises in shielding their prized assets from fire’s wrath. Our success is carved out of deploying robust Fire Protection measures tailored to client requisites, encompassing a spectrum from simplistic pre-engineered systems to advanced multi-hazard clean agent frameworks, each fortress safeguarding millions in assets. Our journey is not merely about averting calamities—it is about forging a safer tomorrow. 
[](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/services/>)
## Customized Solutions
Interstate Fire Protection offers tailored fire suppression systems to meet the unique needs of different industries and applications
[](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/services/>)
## Wide Range of Services
We provide a diverse range of services including installation, maintenance, and various fire suppression systems, catering to both occupied and unoccupied spaces
[](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/services/>)
## Expertise Across Industries
Our expertise spans across multiple industries such as healthcare, industry, data centers, and more, providing specialized solutions for each sector.
[Learn More About Us](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/about> "Learn More About Us")
## Design Services
  * Submittals for permitting
  * Engineering Specifications & Calculations
  * C.A.D. Drawing
  * Cost Engineering


[More about Design Services](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/services/design-services/> "Design Services")
## Installation
  * Engineered Clean Agent Systems
  * High Carbon Dioxide Fire Systems
  * Low Pressure Carbon Dioxide Systems
  * Fire Alarm Systems


[Learn More about Installation](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/services/installation> "Installation")
## Inspection
  * Thorough Inspection
  * Code Compliance
  * Detailed Reporting
  * Maintenance Recommendations


[Learn More about Inspection](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection> "Inspection")
## Maintenance + Repair
  * Regular Maintenance
  * Swift Repairs
  * Quality Assurance
  * System Optimization


[More about Maintenance + Repair](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/</services/maintenance-repair> "Maintenance + Repair")
## Our Products
[View all products](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/</interstate-products> "Products")
Interstate Fire Protection offers a wide array of products, each designed to cater to distinct fire safety needs across various industries. Their offerings include Clean Agent Systems, Vehicle Fire Suppression Systems, Kitchen Fire Suppression, Gas Island Fire Suppression, Marine Fire Suppression, Fire Extinguishers, and other products like paint spray booth systems, water mist systems, firefighting foam, first aid kits, fire hoses, emergency lighting, smoke detectors, and high sensitivity detection systems. These products are engineered to provide comprehensive, cost-effective, and practical solutions ensuring the safety and protection of your valuable assets against fire hazards. 
[ ![](https://www.interstatefire.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/IMG_3215-1-scaled.jpeg) ](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/fire-alarms/>)
[Fire Alarm Systems](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/fire-alarms/>)
Interstate Fire Protection provides state-of-the-art fire alarm systems designed for early detection and alert during fire emergencies, ensuring a safe and prompt response.
[More about Fire Alarm Systems](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/fire-alarms/> "Product: Fire Alarm Systems")
[ ![](https://www.interstatefire.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/Water-Mist-Photo-scaled.jpeg) ](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/water-mist-systems/>)
[Water Mist Systems](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/water-mist-systems/>)
Interstate Fire Protection's water mist systems provide efficient fire suppression, utilizing minimal water to rapidly cool and extinguish fires, ensuring asset and environmental safety
[More about Water Mist Systems](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/water-mist-systems/> "Product: Water Mist Systems")
[ ![Fire Extinguishers](https://www.interstatefire.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/621bbb2354c1fe3b350e7c46_fire-extinguishers-min.jpg) ](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/fire-extinguishers/>)
[Fire Extinguishers](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/fire-extinguishers/>)
From fueling depots to vacation homes, with our product lines of clean agent, liquid agent, dry chemical, foam, CO2 and water based hand held and wheeled units from ANSUL, Badger and Pyro-Chem, Interstate Fire has the extinguisher solution to fit your individual need. Please tell your Safety Director that Interstate Fire also offers classroom and hands on extinguisher training.
[More about Fire Extinguishers](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/fire-extinguishers/> "Product: Fire Extinguishers")
[ ![](https://www.interstatefire.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/622900130cc87c8d3745d3f1_IMG_0284-2.jpg) ](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/marine-fire-suppression/>)

[More about Marine Fire Suppression](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/marine-fire-suppression/> "Product: Marine Fire Suppression")
[ ![Gas Island Fire Suppression](https://www.interstatefire.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/621bbb779bbd8f1085f10fba_gas-island-fire-suppression-min.jpg) ](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/gas-island/>)
[Gas Island](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/gas-island/>)
Protecting your operations from downtime and your critical assets from fire damage is Interstate Fire’s number one priority. Being factory trained and authorized distributors for ANSUL Fire Protection and Kidde Fire Systems our experts can custom fit a suppression system for your equipment that will minimize installation space and maximize fire protection.
[More about Gas Island](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/gas-island/> "Product: Gas Island")
[ ![Kitchen Fire Suppression](https://www.interstatefire.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/6228ccc55b9892f7a0dbca7a_FHDK3083-1.jpeg) ](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/kitchen-fire-suppression/>)
[Kitchen Fire Suppression](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/kitchen-fire-suppression/>)
Interstate Fire Protection offers tailored kitchen fire suppression systems to meet specific needs. They provide standard or hybrid water/wet chemical systems, allowing for easy cleanup post-discharge and minimizing downtime. Particularly, hybrid systems are cost-effective for large kitchens and offer design flexibility, allowing appliance rearrangement without needing system nozzle reinstallation. For non-commercial cooking appliances, the Denlar Fire Suppression Range Hood is offered, ideal for various facilities like Assisted Living Homes, Churches, and Public-School Classrooms, providing an affordable fire protection solution. 
[More about Kitchen Fire Suppression](https://www.interstatefire.com/services/inspection/<https:/www.interstatefire.com/interstate-products/kitchen-fire-suppression/> "Product: Kitchen Fire Suppression")

## We generate results for our customers
“Interstate Fire Protection serviced our Ansul system and fire extinguishers earlier this year. The timely response and service was terrific. Our technicians, Matt and Ben, were professional and the parts required in-stock. As those in the restaurant industry know, it can be tough to maintain quality + production, but Interstate Fire Protection reduced our downtime to service our systems and we were back online quickly.”
Denise H.

Diane Franey

We would love to help! Feel free to reach out to us at any of our locations listed below. We are here for you Monday to Friday from 8am to 5pm, but do not worry, we have you covered with emergency services available 24/7. Looking forward to assisting you with all your fire protection needs!

  • Code Compliance

  • Detailed Reporting

  • Maintenance Recommendations

Learn More about Inspection

Maintenance + Repair

  • Regular Maintenance

  • Swift Repairs

  • Quality Assurance

  • System Optimization

More about Maintenance + Repair

Our Products

View all products

Interstate Fire Protection offers a wide array of products, each designed to cater to distinct fire safety needs across various industries. Their offerings include Clean Agent Systems, Vehicle Fire Suppression Systems, Kitchen Fire Suppression, Gas Island Fire Suppression, Marine Fire Suppression, Fire Extinguishers, and other products like paint spray booth systems, water mist systems, firefighting foam, first aid kits, fire hoses, emergency lighting, smoke detectors, and high sensitivity detection systems. These products are engineered to provide comprehensive, cost-effective, and practical solutions ensuring the safety and protection of your valuable assets against fire hazards.

Fire Alarm Systems

Interstate Fire Protection provides state-of-the-art fire alarm systems designed for early detection and alert during fire emergencies, ensuring a safe and prompt response.

More about Fire Alarm Systems
Water Mist Systems

Interstate Fire Protection's water mist systems provide efficient fire suppression, utilizing minimal water to rapidly cool and extinguish fires, ensuring asset and environmental safety

More about Water Mist Systems
Fire Extinguishers

From fueling depots to vacation homes, with our product lines of clean agent, liquid agent, dry chemical, foam, CO2 and water based hand held and wheeled units from ANSUL, Badger and Pyro-Chem, Interstate Fire has the extinguisher solution to fit your individual need. Please tell your Safety Director that Interstate Fire also offers classroom and hands on extinguisher training.

More about Fire Extinguishers
Marine Fire Suppression

Protecting your operations from downtime and your critical assets from fire damage is Interstate Fire’s number one priority. Being factory trained and authorized distributors for ANSUL Fire Protection and Kidde Fire Systems our experts can custom fit a suppression system for your equipment that will minimize installation space and maximize fire protection.

More about Marine Fire Suppression
Gas Island

Protecting your operations from downtime and your critical assets from fire damage is Interstate Fire’s number one priority. Being factory trained and authorized distributors for ANSUL Fire Protection and Kidde Fire Systems our experts can custom fit a suppression system for your equipment that will minimize installation space and maximize fire protection.

More about Gas Island
Kitchen Fire Suppression

Interstate Fire Protection offers tailored kitchen fire suppression systems to meet specific needs. They provide standard or hybrid water/wet chemical systems, allowing for easy cleanup post-discharge and minimizing downtime. Particularly, hybrid systems are cost-effective for large kitchens and offer design flexibility, allowing appliance rearrangement without needing system nozzle reinstallation. For non-commercial cooking appliances, the Denlar Fire Suppression Range Hood is offered, ideal for various facilities like Assisted Living Homes, Churches, and Public-School Classrooms, providing an affordable fire protection solution.

More about Kitchen Fire Suppression

Real-life results

We generate results for our customers

Let’s work on your project together

We would love to help! Feel free to reach out to us at any of our locations listed below. We are here for you Monday to Friday from 8am to 5pm, but do not worry, we have you covered with emergency services available 24/7. Looking forward to assisting you with all your fire protection needs!

#  Frequently Asked Questions
* * *
Please reach us if you cannot find an answer to your question.
What Are The Different Types Of Fire Alarms?
There are two major types of fire alarms: ionization fire alarms and photoelectric fire alarms. Ionization fire alarms detect flaming, fast moving fires – curtain fires, trash can fires, etc. Photoelectric fire alarms are best for smoky, smoldering fires, such as electrical fires that start out behind walls. There are also dual sensor fire alarms which, naturally, combine both types into one. To maximize your fire protection, you should install both types (or a combination of the two) to make sure you are completely covered. 
* * *
Do I Need Both A Fire Alarm System And A Sprinkler System?
In short, yes. Fire sprinkler systems are great for putting out fires after they start, but they only come on once the fire has reached a certain temperature, at which point it will have already done damage. Fire alarm systems, particularly smoke detectors, round out your fire protection because they detect smoke and other gases before the flames start, giving you extra time to escape the building. They can also automatically alert the fire department. 
* * *
Is Fire Alarm Monitoring Worth It?
Fire alarm monitoring is basically a guarantee your building has eyes on it 24/7, keeping it protected from fires at all times. If the fire alarms go off in your building, the fire alarm monitoring company will notify the fire department within seconds – even if you’re not there, or if you’re in the process of safely evacuating. Everyone has heard horror stories of people showing up to work and seeing the charred wreckage of what was once their office (and all their equipment, data, etc.) – don’t let this happen to you! 
* * *
How Do Fire Sprinkler Systems Work?
Most conventional sprinkler heads use a small, liquid-filled bulb that acts as a plug to prevent water from escaping out of the sprinkler. Extreme heat causes this liquid to expand, eventually causing the bulb to burst and release the water behind it.
  

The liquid inside the bulbs comes in a variety of colors, and each color represents the temperature required to activate the sprinkler:
  * Orange – 135°F
  * Red – 155°F
  * Yellow – 174°F
  * Green – 200°F
  * Blue – 286°F
  * Purple – 360°F
  * Black – 440°F


* * *
Don’t Fire Sprinklers Cause Water Damage?
Yes. But consider the alternatives: either your building burns down, or the fire department arrives and basically floods your building until the fire dies down (remember, fire sprinklers deliver about 18 gpm, whereas firefighter hoses deliver 60 or more!). 
* * *
What Are The Maintenance Requirements For My Fire Extinguishers?
Annual inspections, internal maintenance, and hydrostatic testing must be performed by a licensed fire protection company.
  

  * Monthly inspection by the owner of the fire extinguisher
  * Annual professional fire extinguisher inspection
  * Internal (six-year) fire extinguisher maintenance (also referred to as tear down)
  * Hydrostatic testing every 12 years (five years for vehicle-mounted and some others)


  

* * *

Licenses: ACR - 3008843 / SCR-G 3033014 / ECR 3059748

    • Fire Extinguishers
  • Contact us
  • Blog

  • Reviews

Frequently Asked Questions

Please reach us if you cannot find an answer to your question.

 There are two major types of fire alarms: ionization fire alarms and photoelectric fire alarms. Ionization fire alarms detect flaming, fast moving fires – curtain fires, trash can fires, etc. Photoelectric fire alarms are best for smoky, smoldering fires, such as electrical fires that start out behind walls. There are also dual sensor fire alarms which, naturally, combine both types into one. To maximize your fire protection, you should install both types (or a combination of the two) to make sure you are completely covered. 

 In short, yes. Fire sprinkler systems are great for putting out fires after they start, but they only come on once the fire has reached a certain temperature, at which point it will have already done damage. Fire alarm systems, particularly smoke detectors, round out your fire protection because they detect smoke and other gases before the flames start, giving you extra time to escape the building. They can also automatically alert the fire department. 

 Fire alarm monitoring is basically a guarantee your building has eyes on it 24/7, keeping it protected from fires at all times. If the fire alarms go off in your building, the fire alarm monitoring company will notify the fire department within seconds – even if you’re not there, or if you’re in the process of safely evacuating. Everyone has heard horror stories of people showing up to work and seeing the charred wreckage of what was once their office (and all their equipment, data, etc.) – don’t let this happen to you! 

Most conventional sprinkler heads use a small, liquid-filled bulb that acts as a plug to prevent water from escaping out of the sprinkler. Extreme heat causes this liquid to expand, eventually causing the bulb to burst and release the water behind it.


The liquid inside the bulbs comes in a variety of colors, and each color represents the temperature required to activate the sprinkler:

  • Orange – 135°F
  • Red – 155°F
  • Yellow – 174°F
  • Green – 200°F
  • Blue – 286°F
  • Purple – 360°F
  • Black – 440°F

 Yes. But consider the alternatives: either your building burns down, or the fire department arrives and basically floods your building until the fire dies down (remember, fire sprinklers deliver about 18 gpm, whereas firefighter hoses deliver 60 or more!). 

 Annual inspections, internal maintenance, and hydrostatic testing must be performed by a licensed fire protection company.


  • Monthly inspection by the owner of the fire extinguisher
  • Annual professional fire extinguisher inspection
  • Internal (six-year) fire extinguisher maintenance (also referred to as tear down)
  • Hydrostatic testing every 12 years (five years for vehicle-mounted and some others)

# Fire Extinguisher Services
## Expert Fire Extinguisher Services
FirePro Tech LLC is your trusted partner for comprehensive **fire extinguisher services**. We are committed to safety and excellence in our fire protection solutions. Our expert services not only ensure compliance with the local and national fire codes, but also aim to boost your fire protection measures to the highest standards. We offer a full range of [fire protection services](https://fireprotechllc.com/services/fire-extinguisher-services/</>), including inspection, maintenance, installation, and training, to ensure that your fire extinguishers are always ready to safeguard lives and property in case of a fire emergency.
Fire extinguisher services at FirePro are conducted by our team of highly trained and certified technicians, who have extensive experience and knowledge in fire safety. They go beyond routine checks, examining every aspect of your equipment, such as the cylinder, valve, hose, nozzle, gauge, and label. They also perform precise pressure and weight assessments, using specialized tools and equipment, to ensure that your fire extinguishers are fully charged and functional.
![Expert Fire Extinguisher Services - FirePro Tech LLC](https://fireprotechllc.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/Expert-Fire-Extinguisher-Services-FirePro-Tech-LLC.jpg)
![Importance of Fire Extinguisher Services - FirePro Tech LLC](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20479%20479'%3E%3C/svg%3E)
## Importance of Fire Extinguisher Services
Fire extinguisher services are very important for safety. They are also required by law. We check and fix your fire extinguishers to make sure they work well and follow the rules. We help you follow the local and national fire safety codes. We make sure your fire extinguishers meet and exceed these standards. This gives you and your family peace of mind.
We inspect your fire extinguishers regularly and find any problems. We make sure your fire extinguishers are ready to use and have enough pressure and weight. We fix any issues quickly. This makes your fire protection systems more reliable and reduces the damage from fire. We help you make your community safer by providing trustworthy **fire extinguisher services**.
## What Our Fire Extinguisher Services Include
[FirePro Tech LLC](https://fireprotechllc.com/services/fire-extinguisher-services/</>) cares about your safety and offers fire extinguisher services. We know that fire extinguishers are more than just equipment. We focus on excellence, reliability, and proactivity in fire safety. By choosing our services, you are not just investing in equipment maintenance; you are investing in a complete fire safety approach that makes you ready, responsive, and safe.
  * Conducting checks on your fire extinguishers, examining their overall condition, pressure, and weight.
  * Performing thorough checks, cleaning each unit, and implements preventive measures.
  * Ensuring that your extinguishers are consistently stocked with sufficient material, ready to combat any fire hazard.
  * Our hydrostatic testing procedures go beyond routine checks, guaranteeing that your equipment functions well.
  * Addressing malfunctions or breakdowns promptly, our team ensures that your 
  * Offering practical guidance on fire extinguisher usage and essential protocols in the event of a fire.


## Why Choose FirePro Tech LLC Fire Extinguisher Services
When you choose FirePro Tech LLC for fire extinguisher services, you’re selecting a partner dedicated to excellence and safety. Our team of trained and certified technicians, coupled with cutting-edge technology, sets us apart. Here’s why FirePro Tech LLC is the ideal choice:
  * Expertise in various extinguisher types
  * Ongoing training programs for our technicians
  * Cutting-edge technology and state-of-the-art equipment
  * Tailored solutions catering to different industries
  * Transparent pricing with competitive packages
  * Thorough inspections covering condition, pressure, and weight
  * Annual servicing, ensuring long-term equipment functionality
  * Prompt refilling services to maintain optimal readiness
  * Hydrostatic testing for enhanced safety and compliance
  * 24/7 emergency repair services for immediate aid
  * Educational insights to empower clients with fire safety knowledge
  * A commitment to compliance to industry standards.


![Choose FirePro Tech LLC for Fire Extinguisher Services – FirePro Tech LLC](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20479%20479'%3E%3C/svg%3E)
## Choose FirePro Tech LLC for Fire Extinguisher Services
For unparalleled fire extinguisher services, turn to [FirePro Tech LLC](https://fireprotechllc.com/services/fire-extinguisher-services/</>)– your premier choice for comprehensive fire safety solutions. Our dedicated team ensures that your fire extinguishers are not only compliant but also well-maintained, utilizing cutting-edge technology and expert installations. Choose FirePro Tech LLC for:
  * **Expert Inspections**
  * **Routine Maintenance**
  * **Timely Refilling Services**
  * **Hydrostatic Testing**

Choose FirePro Tech LLC for a commitment to excellence, reliability, and a steadfast dedication to your safety. # ABOUT US
* * *
# ABOUT US
Serving the community **since 1948, Huser Fire Fighting Equipment** offers sales, installation, and service of a variety of fire safety equipment, including state of the art fire suppression systems, to clients in the Portland, OR and surrounding areas. 
Locally owned and operated, our sales employees are factory trained, tested, and hold valid certification as per the National Fire Protection Association. We are an authorized distributor of 
**We are licensed, bonded, and insured.** Oregon state contractor’s license CCB #220044, Washing WA #HUSERFF829KP. **We offer 24-hour emergency service** and are members of NAFED, ORFED, and NFPA. Serving customers throughout Oregon and southwest Washington.

# OTHER SERVICES
We are your hydrotesting specialists. We offer a wide variety of services from system installation to OSHA required fire extinguisher training.  
  
OUR FIRE SAFETY EQUIPMENT PRODUCTS AND SERVICES INCLUDE:
  * **INSTALLATION –** including fire extinguishers and fire suppression systems 
  * **MAINTENANCE**
  * **TESTING –** including DOT cylinder requalification and hydrotesting
  * **CERTIFIED BREATHING AIR REFILLING for SCBA and SCUBA TANKS**
  * **COMPUTER BASED FIRE EXTINGUISHER TRAINING –** an OSHA requirement
  * **FIRST AID SUPPLIES and FIRST AID KITS**
  * **SAFETY EQUIPMENT –** including hard hats and gloves 


.
­
